info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 13 at 5:14PM EDT until May 13 at 6:15PM EDT by NWS State College PA
info.description:
At 514 PM EDT, Flooding from earlier and ongoing heavy rain continues. Water rescues are occurring in Meyersdale and Salisbury. Evacuations are also in progress for low lying areas of Meyersdale and shelters have been set up. A land slide has occurred on state route 219, north of Boynton. A number of local rain gauge reports are in the 3.5 to 4.5 inch range since this morning.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management (observed).
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Somerset, Meyersdale, Berlin, Friedens, New Centerville, Mount Davis, Lake Gordon, Hyndman, Rockwood, Salisbury, Garrett, Indian Lake, Shanksville, Wellersburg, New Baltimore, Casselman, Callimont and Flight 93 National Memorial.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Kimberly Run, Tiger Run, Wolf Camp Run, Flaugherty Creek, Three Lick Run, Wills Creek, Raystown Branch Juniata River, Glades Creek, Zehner Run, Parson Run, Town Line Run, Millers Run, West Branch Coxes Creek, Wells Creek, Panther Run, Evitts Creek, Glade Run, Elklick Creek, Flag Run, Red Run, Reitz Creek, Thompson Run, Middle Creek, Laurel Hill Creek, North Branch Jennings Run, Poorbaugh Run, Clear Run, Brush Creek, McClintock Run, Hillegas Run, Buffalo Creek, Wilson Creek, Kegg Run, Laurel Run, Tar Water Creek, Bromm Run, Stonycreek River, Kimmel Run, Shaffers Run, Blue Lick Creek, Cove Run, Smally Spring Branch, East Branch Coxes Creek, Little Wills Creek, Piney Creek, Ware Run, Coxes Creek, Buck Run, Shafer Run, Savage Run, Tub Mill Run, Casselman River, Whites Creek, Oster Run, Beaverdam Creek, Rhoads Creek, Shade Creek and Meadow Run.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHWESTERN BEDFORD AND SOUTHERN SOMERSET COUNTIES
